title: Strategies for Overcoming Practical Barriers to Technology-Integrated Instructional Methods

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language teaching theory and understanding of smartphone utilization
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented education utilizing VR simulations and mobile-based instructional tools in smartphone-centric limited technological environments

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain at least three psychological and experiential barriers encountered during the adoption of teaching skills.
Learners can diagnose their own teaching self-efficacy and propose methods to incorporate it into a technology integration plan.
Learners can design a prototype for a lesson plan utilizing language teaching technology tools (such as chatbots and speech analysis apps) in a VR simulation environment.
Learners can complete a project evaluating the feasibility of implementing technology-integrated teaching methods based on peer feedback.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
